What kind of information can we get from the description? What are we solving for?
The initial velocity is 25 m/s at an angle of 30Â° above the horizontal. What are the x and y components of the initial velocity?

Focusing our attention in the vertical direction, we know the initial velocity, \(v_{0,y}\), and the final velocity, \(v_{f,y}\), when the dolphin is passing through the hoop at the maximum height. You also know that the acceleration is due to gravity, i.e. \(a_y = -g\). Which equation of motion would you like to use to solve the problem? Note that there is more than one acceptable answer.
You have selected the following equations of motion: \(v_{y,f}=v_{0,y}+a_y t\) and \(\Delta y = v_{0,y} t + 1/2 a t^2\). Which of the following options correctly applies these equations of motions?

The initial velocity is 10 m/s and is entirely horizontal. What are the x and y components of the initial velocity?

Focusing our attention in the vertical direction, we know the initial velocity, \(v_{0,y}\)=0. You also know that the acceleration is due to gravity, i.e. \(a_y = -g\). Which equation of motion would you like to use to solve the problem? Note that there is more than one acceptable answer.
